summary: The Student Athlete Fairness and Enforcement Act aims to protect student athletes. It establishes name, image, and likeness (NIL) protections, covering rights, reporting requirements, and contract regulations.  It also addresses transfer rules, draft protections, health and safety standards, scholarship safeguards, and non-discrimination. The bill includes provisions for student visas, college broadcast media rights, and the establishment of an Athlete Ombuds office. Enforcement and oversight are assigned to the Federal Trade Commission and state authorities.
